articles.content: After waking early in his student halls last Monday, Michael Bryans morning routine was much like any other. He went for a jog, showered, and dressed himself in chinos and a blazer. But instead of heading to his local shop for essentials, or to the park for h… [+2645 chars]

articles.author: Sophie Brownson
articles.title: No further deaths reported at hospital trust caring for patients in South Tyneside as North East total reaches 1,055 - Shields Gazette
articles.description: There have been 12 new cases of coronavirus recorded in South Tyneside – but there have been no further deaths at the borough’s hospital trust.
articles.content:
The latest figures released on Saturday, May 2, show there has been a rise of 12 new Covid-19 cases in South Tyneside, as the total stands at 568.
It comes as the number of people to have died after contracting Covid-19 at hospitals served by South Tyneside … [+3375 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Queues build as Manchester tips reopen - BBC News
articles.description: Cars lined up for 30 minutes before some recycling centres opened for the first time since lockdown.
articles.content:

Queues built up outside tips in Manchester as they reopened for the first time since lockdown.

articles.title: Live coronavirus updates as Matt Hancock reveals Government has hit 100,000 daily tests target - WalesOnline
articles.description: It comes as 739 further coronavirus deaths have been recorded in the UK
articles.content:
England's health secretary Matt Hancock has announced that the UK Government has hit its target of 100,000 daily tests, hailing it as an "incredible achievement".

articles.title: Coronavirus: Scientists conclude people cannot be infected twice - Sky News
articles.description: A total of 277 patients in the country were believed to have fallen ill for a second time, as had patients in China and Japan.
